clinical_study.brief_title: Pharyngitis,Group A Streptococcal Infection,Rapid Streptococcal Test,Throat Swab Culture
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Immunochromatographic Test for Rapid Detection of Group A Streptococcal Antigen With Culture in Pediatric Patients

brief_summary.textblock: Comparison of Immunochromatographic Test for rapid detection of group A streptococcal antigen with culture in Pediatric patients.

detailed_description.textblock: Throat swabbing by two port germ Amines agar (copan) swabs,then the swabs were randomly labeled as swab A and swab B.Swab A was processed for rapid streptococcal test and swab B was processed for culture in Colombia blood agar.All patients were followed up after 48-72 hours with the final culture results that ultimately determined the need to continue or discontinue treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: The ratio of true negative rapid immunochromatographic strep test when compared throat culture

secondary_outcome.measure: The ratio of true positive rapid immunochromatographic strep test when compared to throat culture

arm_group.description: Throat swabbing by two port germ Amines agar (copan) swabs,the swabs were randomly labeled as swab A and swab B.Swab A was processed for rapid streptococcal test and swab B was processed for culture in Colombia blood agar.All patients were followed up after 48-72 hours with the final culture results that ultimately determined the need to continue or discontinue treatment.

intervention.description: Throat swab obtained for rapid strep test in addition to throat culture,in order to check the accuracy of Rapid Immunochromatographic streptococcal test in detection of streptococcal pharyngitis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients presenting with the possible diagnosis of Bacterial pharyngitis,between 1-14 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who received antibiotics within two weeks from presentation
